definition: to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: The LORD finds us enough reasons for prayer, and we ought to thank Him that it is so.
sentences.chinese: 上帝乐意听我们的琐碎絮语，我们也该为此献上感谢。

sentences.english: He offered her the white rose.
He presented a bunch of flowers to the honored guest.
sentences.chinese: 他向尊敬的客人献上一束花。

sentences.english: If you're lucky, the staff will serenade you with North Korean folk songs.
sentences.chinese: 如果幸运的话，服务员还会献上几曲朝鲜民歌。

sentences.english: A Christmas greeting to cheer you,my goodfriend.
sentences.chinese: 献上令你开心的圣诞祝福，我的好友。

sentences.english: Christian should give God praise and give man gospel.
sentences.chinese: 一个基督徒，向神应献上赞美，向人应传讲福音。

sentences.english: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 当献上公义的祭，又当倚靠耶和华。

sentences.english: One kiss at the right time, and she knew she had found Mr. Right.
sentences.chinese: 在正确的时间献上一吻，她就知道她找到如意郎君了。

sentences.english: I will not pour out their libations of blood or take up their names on my lips.
sentences.chinese: 他们所浇奠的血我不献上，我嘴唇也不题别神的名号。

sentences.english: The first lion was presented to China during the Eastern Han Dynasty by a king from the Western Regions.
sentences.chinese: 东汉时，西域安息国王向中国献上了第一头狮子。

sentences.english: and if ye offer the lame and sick, is it not evil?
sentences.chinese: 将瘸腿的，有病的献上，这不为恶吗。

sentences.english: Lark used dulcet singing offered wonderful performance for animals. The lion king was very happy.
sentences.chinese: 百灵鸟用婉转的歌声给动物们献上了精彩的演出。

sentences.english: We thank you for your unsparing love and support all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我们感谢大家一直以来所献上的毫无保留的爱和支持。

sentences.english: Your great name I sing, My offering of praise I bring.
sentences.chinese: 因祢奇妙圣名，献上我的赞美。

sentences.english: One of the guests presented fish and gooses.
sentences.chinese: 坐席中有人献上鱼和鹅。

sentences.english: Please pray for Pastor Liu and his family.
sentences.chinese: 请弟兄姐妹为刘牧师及他的家人献上祷告。

definition: to offer/to give (as tribute)/to devote (one's life)/to sacrifice (oneself)
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
(slang) to cheer sb on/to show one's support/("call" is pronounced approximately like English "call")
to send/to give as a present
to send to/to deliver to/to give sb a lift (e.g. in a car)
to express/to present/to extend/to tender (greetings, thanks etc)
to add to the fun/to liven things up
